creator: ant@untruth.org.uk
text:
Using 1.7 beta:
If I create an 'HTTP Request Defaults' object with HTTP parameters in it and 
then an 'HTTP Request' with some more parameters, then when I run the test only 
the parameters from the 'HTTP Request' object are used.  It looks like the list 
of parameters, as a whole, is being merged, rather than merging the parameters 
individually.  I think the latter behaviour would be much more useful and 
intuitive (but I could be wrong :-).

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I think you are misunderstanding how this works.  JMeter only fills in blanks 
in your HTTP Requests parameter fields - it doesn't override.  If you want all 
HTTP Requests in your test to share the same "DOMAIN" field, leave them blank, 
then create an HTTP Request Defaults at a higher level (say, ThreadGroup), with 
the DOMAIN field filled in. This should accomplish what you desire.

Sorry - my explaination was a bit poor.

What I mean by HTTP parameters are the parameters that would be sent after 
the '?' in the URL i.e. www.acme.com/review.dhtml?id=560.

I agree that if the same parameter is defined twice then the deffinition lower 
down the tree should be used - but if parameters are defined high in the tree 
(and not redefined lower down) then they should also be used.
creator: ant@untruth.org.uk

text:
Oh, I get it.  Sounds strange - can you give an example where one would want to 
do this?
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
I am currently load testing a portal that I have been developing.  The portal 
has several sections (depending on what type of info you are looking for) and 
each section is split into many categories.  The section and category are 
determined by parameters passed in the URL - this is a fairly common type of 
setup.  I need to run tests on a sample of categories (say 10) in each 
section.  It would be nice if, rather than having to define the sectionId 
parameter for each test, I could inherit it from some default parameters for 
that group of tests.
creator: ant@untruth.org.uk

text: I'm calling this an enhancement request.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
ant@untruth.org.uk
text:
Fine.  I've worked round it now so I don't mind - but I think it would be 
useful for others.  Thanks for your time.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text: This is enabled in the new src_1 sources

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
